metadata.title: Green Day - When I Come Around
metadata.creator: Green Day

tracks.text: A city at night.
Seen through a window, a woman with red curly 80's hair and blue eye shadow walks behind her TV. She wears a white T-shirt and floral shorts.

The band members walk down the street. The woman plays cards. The apartment has lime green walls, his and hers cactus lamps, red carpeted floors, and a matching red rotary phone sitting. Behind her is a table with 2 chairs facing different directions. The woman sits alone on a love seat.
Behind the redheaded woman, a man walks by. He wears a blue and yellow bath robe and has unkempt black hair. He walks by the woman, who doesn't look up. He picks up a comb, and looks out a window.
The band members walk down the street.

The man in the bath robe looks across the street, at a woman in red pencil skirt and long sleeved jacket. She wears a white derby hat with black feathers, evocative of the 1920's. She's in a room with blue carpet and walls. The man in the bathrobe combs his hair while watching the woman in the derby hat carefully arrange bottles on a glass table. She picks up a black purse.
The band members walk past a video store. A trolley bus drives past.
The woman in the derby hat checks her makeup in a round mirror covered in shells. She checks her watch, walks by silver geometric lamps, and stares intently through a window.

A black man in a brown suit puts a necklace around his young daughter's neck. She wears a 19th century dress with a feathered bonnet. The 2 stand in a room with red walls with white trim. The lamps are bronze children holding wheat.
The girl checks her makeup in a mirror. The band members walk through a subway station.
The girl walks past a poster of foggy woods that stretches across her entire wall. She walks up to a window, where a telescope is pointed toward the street.
She peers through a telescope, and sees a man in a green suit pace in an alley way by a dumpster. He lights a cigarette.
The band members walk through a long hallway in the station. Drummer Tres Cool wears a white jacket, a green shirt, and a name tag saying 'idiot'. He leans against the wall as he walks.
The man by the dumpster notices something in the distance. A couple of teenagers kiss against a car hood under a street light.
The band members walk by a map of the Bay Area Rapid Transit map.

The kissing teenagers separate and walk away, holding hands. They slowly climb stairs, until they notice something and stop to look. An old man in a wheel chair and an oxygen tank frowns, staring at the night.
Fast forwarded POV shot of a car driving several blocks down the road.
The old man rolls his wheelchair. He's in a room with white carpet and white walls.
The band members walk down a hallway with narrow pastel colored panelling. Bassist Mike Dirnt spreads his arm, easily reaching both sides of the hall at once.

The old man in the wheelchair stares out his window. Balley students hold a ballet pose. A sign reads Dance Academy. The old man's face appears downfallen. A woman assumes a position, and children mimic her.
A ballet student in green walks to the window. The band members walk down the pastel hallway.
The ballet student looks up through the window. The man in the bathrobe matches the ballerina's gaze.
Shots of windows across San Francisco at night. Fade to black.
